issue.title: audiobookbay.lu
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

79219-5540

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://audiobookbay.lu/abss/charlie-chan-carries-on-1930-earl-derr-biggers/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Legitimate URL Shortener, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List, Peter Lowe's Blocklist, Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, EasyList Cookie List

### Security

Online Malicious URL Blocklist

### Other

AdGuard Experimental filter

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

EasyList Hebrew

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Send Do-Not-Track signals, Block WebRTC, Block Push API, Block Location API, Hide your User-Agent (specify in comment below, if used custom value), Mask your IP address (specify in comment below, if used custom value)

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Fake download links remain and can be removed with the following filters:
##[href^="/download"]
or
##td span a:has-text(Torrent Free Downloads)

##.ski

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/156966833/ddfb8992-4a71-4848-a9ff-61644fe17d5a)
</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2:</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/156966833/c24b263c-e99e-482f-933a-4681b9bee54a)

</details>


### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: hikaritube.com

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [NSFW] [https://hikaritube.com/video.php?id=118422](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fhikaritube.com%2Fvideo.php%3Fid%3D118422) ### Comment > This issue is caused by Adguard on iPhone's inability to handle iframes properly. There is no specific rule in place to hide the ad placeholder. On PC, blocking the script reduces the size to 0, effectively hiding the ad frame. However, on iPhone, the iframe remains visible, which is why it's expected that the ad frame does not disappear. If there are any other reasons contributing to this behavior, please let me know for future reference. ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/nbslo16md68owksws8cc8s8s04k4cskkeg8gu3dnrk.jpg?nc=1) [Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/2y8g2isy5ayooksk8k484ww0k4wgoo0m8lmqv6c40g.jpg?nc=1) [Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ij6t3ia3ng0sss04wgogk440kss4g4wppgz1oe77v4.jpg?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.3 DNS filtering: | server: `https://doh.quad9.net/dns-query`

issue.title: hikaritube.com

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [NSFW] [https://hikaritube.com/video.php?id=118422](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fhikaritube.com%2Fvideo.php%3Fid%3D118422) ### Comment > This issue is caused by Adguard on iPhone's inability to handle iframes properly. There is no specific rule in place to hide the ad placeholder. On PC, blocking the script reduces the size to 0, effectively hiding the ad frame. However, on iPhone, the iframe remains visible, which is why it's expected that the ad frame does not disappear. If there are any other reasons contributing to this behavior, please let me know for future reference. ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/nbslo16md68owksws8cc8s8s04k4cskkeg8gu3dnrk.jpg?nc=1) [Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/2y8g2isy5ayooksk8k484ww0k4wgoo0m8lmqv6c40g.jpg?nc=1) [Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ij6t3ia3ng0sss04wgogk440kss4g4wppgz1oe77v4.jpg?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.3 DNS filtering: | server: `https://doh.quad9.net/dns-query`

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://nukistream.com/rank.php](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnukistream.com%2Frank.php) ### Comment > Image1 is Ads placeholder > Image2 is PR Ad > > The problem arises because Adguard on iPhone struggles to manage iframes effectively. It lacks a specific rule to conceal the space reserved for advertisements. While on a PC, disabling the script reduces the space to zero, the scenario differs on an iPhone. Due to the persistence of the iframe, it's expected that the advertisement frame remains visible. ### Screenshots

issue.title: Cleanup duplicate rules in TurkishFilter
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

There are duplicate rules present in the filters.

```
##.ap-728x90
##.masthead
##.masthead-top
##.notices
##.rek-wrap
##.slickModal
###fancybox-overlay
###fancybox-wrap
##div[class^="code-block code-block-"]
##div[id^="ENGAGEYA_WIDGET_"]
##div[id^="divFLRA"]
```



### Proposed solution

Remove redundant rules or merge multiple rules into a single rule where possible.

### Additional information

These rules are grouped by domain, so I was unable to determine whether I should merge the rules. 
If necessary, the maintainer side should merge them or please send a comment on the pull request.
Here are examples of such rules:
```
##iframe[src*="/rklm/"]
##div[style="height:262px;"]
##a[target="_blank"] > video
##a[href^="https://bit.ly/"]
##.single-adsense
##.modal-backdrop
##.dikreklamsag
```

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

comment.body:
Well this is awkward! Since posting this I have yet to get any ads. Even with the personal filtering rules disabled. That's great for me, however not so great for the follow up on this problem. I would consider this one closed for now. I can not reproduce it anymore.
Thank you for your quick reaction times and awesome support as always. Till the next time!

Cleanup duplicate rules in UkrainianFilter (#175022)

* ##.code-block

* ##.sb-partners

* ##.widget-type-banners

* edinstvennaya.ua#?#.wrapper__content div.main:has(> div[class] > div.banner-horizontal)

There is a rule on line 124 that is exactly the same.
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/32bb5d1fdff887f533160fbd62523798ebaaa980/CyrillicFilters/UkrainianFilter/sections/specific.txt#L130

issue.title: Cleanup duplicate rules in UkrainianFilter
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

There are multiple duplicate rules present in the filters.
```
##.code-block
##.sb-partners
##.widget-type-banners
edinstvennaya.ua#?#.wrapper__content div.main:has(> div[class] > div.banner-horizontal)
```

### Proposed solution

Remove redundant rules or merge multiple rules into a single rule where possible.

### Additional information

_No response_
